imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings

Interface Mapping2D

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AffineMapping2D, BilinearMapping, LinearMapping2D, ProjectiveMapping2D, RippleMapping, Rotation2D, Scaling2D, Shear2D, SphereMapping, Translation2D, TwirlMapping

    public interface Mapping2D
extends Cloneable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point applyTo(Point pnt)
      Applies this mapping to a single 2D point.
      default Point[] applyTo(Point[] pnts) 
      default Mapping2D getInverse()
      The inverse of this mapping is calculated (if possible) and returned.
      default double[][] getJacobian(Point xy)
      Returns the Jacobian matrix for this mapping, evaluated at the given 2D point.

    • Method Detail

      • applyTo

        Point applyTo(Point pnt)
        Applies this mapping to a single 2D point.
        Parameters:
        pnt - the original point
        Returns:
        the transformed point

      • applyTo

        default Point[] applyTo(Point[] pnts)

      • getInverse

        default Mapping2D getInverse()
        The inverse of this mapping is calculated (if possible) and returned. Implementing classes are supposed to override this default method.
        Returns:
        the inverse mapping

      • getJacobian

        default double[][] getJacobian(Point xy)
        Returns the Jacobian matrix for this mapping, evaluated at the given 2D point. This method is only implemented for selected mappings.
        Parameters:
        xy - the 2D position to calculate the Jacobian for
        Returns:
        the Jacobian matrix
